templateParameters.name: courseLevel
templateParameters.description: This is a unique identifier for course level

properties.description: Retrieves a specific course level.
Retrieves a list of course levels. This end point is used to populate the drop down for the level drop down in the course page.

queryParameters.name: limit
queryParameters.description: The number of records to return. Defaults to the maximum (100) if no value is specified.

queryParameters.name: offset
queryParameters.description: The number of records to skip before returning results. Defaults to zero if no value is specified.

queryParameters.name: sort
queryParameters.description: The field name on which to sort. Defaults to modifyDate if not specified.

queryParameters.name: order
queryParameters.description: The direction of the sort. Defaults to descending if not specified.

queryParameters.description: The number of jobs to return. Defaults to the maximum (100) if no value is specified.

responses.description: Returns active jobs that conform to the query parameters.

properties.description: Returns courses. Supports paging via query string parameters.

queryParameters.name: limit
queryParameters.description: The number of jobs to return. Defaults to the maximum (100) if no value is specified.

queryParameters.name: offset
queryParameters.description: The number of jobs to skip before returning results. Defaults to zero if no value is specified.

queryParameters.name: sort
queryParameters.description: The field name on which to sort. Defaults to ModifyDate if not specified.  The following are valid sorts: Title, Topic, Level, ModifyDate,CreateDate and VendorName

queryParameters.name: order
queryParameters.description: The direction of the sort. Defaults to descending if not specified

queryParameters.name: keyword
queryParameters.description: The keyword(s) on which to base the job search.

queryParameters.name: Level
queryParameters.description:
Course level filter.  Valid values are "Beginner", "Intermediate" 
 and "Advanced"

queryParameters.name: Topic
queryParameters.description:
Course topic filter. Valid values are 
"Data Science",
"Cyber Security"
"Full Stack"

Note: in stage pre-pend "Dev" to topic name.  e.g. "Dev Full Stack"

responses.description: Returns courses that conform to the query parameters.

templateParameters.name: course
templateParameters.description: This is a unique identifier for a course

properties.description: Returns courses related to a course based on skill association. A valid subscriber JWT being supplied does not affect the output of this endpoint as all courses are online-based (geographic data does not influence courses).

queryParameters.name: limit
queryParameters.description: The number of courses to return. Defaults to the maximum (100) if no value is specified.

queryParameters.name: offset
queryParameters.description: The number of courses to skip before returning results. Defaults to zero if no value is specified.

responses.description: A list of courses that are related to the specified course.

properties.description: Returns a list of courses that are associated with the list of courses provided in the body of the HTTP request (POST).

request.description: A list of courses (which is an array of their unique identifiers).

queryParameters.name: offset
queryParameters.description: The number of courses to skip.

headers.description: Indicates the media type of the resource

templateParameters.name: job
templateParameters.description: This is a unique identifier for a job.

properties.description: Updates a specific job.

Creates a job alert for the job and subscriber defined by the url template parameters. A subscriber may only have five active job alerts at any given time. Note that the dates and times are UTC (it is the responsibility of the calling code to convert to the user's local time zone).

request.description: The job alert to be created. Note that the dates and times are UTC (it is the responsibility of the calling code to convert to the user's local time zone). Only two values may be passed to "frequency": "Weekly" or "Daily". Weekly alerts require the "executionDayOfWeek" parameter to be populated - acceptable values for this field are "Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", and "Saturday". For Daily alerts, the "executionDayOfWeek" parameter is ignored.

templateParameters.name: jobAlert
templateParameters.description: This is a unique identitifer for a job alert

properties.description: Performs a logical deletion for a job alert.

templateParameters.name: jobAlert
templateParameters.description: This is a unique identifier for a job alert

properties.description: Updates a job alert for the job and subscriber defined by the url template parameters. A subscriber may only have five active job alerts at any given time. Note that the dates and times are UTC (it is the responsibility of the calling code to convert to the user's local time zone).

request.description: The job alert to be created. Note that the dates and times are UTC (it is the responsibility of the calling code to convert to the user's local time zone). Only two values may be passed to "frequency": "Weekly" or "Daily". Weekly alerts require the "executionDayOfWeek" parameter to be populated - acceptable values for this field are "Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", and "Saturday". For Daily alerts, the "executionDayOfWeek" parameter is ignored.

properties.description: Retrieves a list of job alerts for a subscriber. Note that the hours returned are in UTC and must be converted to local time.
